pageContext.claim: “Ohio sees it just about better than anybody because you see the car companies back, the car companies expanding, other companies are coming back. Remember, they were all leaving, now they're all coming back, folks. They're all coming back.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. Only one new car factory has been announced since Trump became president: a Toyota-Mazda  assembly plant in Alabama. And Fiat Chrysler said it would shift production of heavy-duty trucks from Mexico to a plant in Warren, Mich. A few weeks after this rally, GM announced it would end production at five plants in Michigan, Maryland and Ohio.
